programme.desc: Two teenagers on the cusp of adulthood meet and fall in love over four significant days of the year.(n)

programme.title: SWEET DREAMS
programme.desc: Forced into rehab, Morris agrees to coach a misfit softball team of recovering addicts to prove that everyone, despite their past, can hit a home run.(n)

programme.title: THE DEBT
programme.desc: A former Mossad agent discovers a present truth that makes her question her past in this espionage thriller.(n)

programme.title: SONIC THE HEDGEHOG 3
programme.desc: Sonic, Knuckles, and Tails are back for their most epic adventure yet. The team reunite to face a new formidable foe, Shadow.(n)

programme.title: SINBAD: LEGEND OF THE SEVEN SEAS
programme.desc: Brad Pitt and Catherine Zeta-Jones lend their voices to this adventure-filled animated tale.(n)

programme.title: GRUDGE MATCH
programme.desc: Thirty years after their last title fight, two retired boxers and lifelong rivals decide to step into the ring once more to settle an old score.(n)

programme.title: WINTER SPRING SUMMER OR FALL
programme.desc: Two teenagers on the cusp of adulthood meet and fall in love over four significant days of the year.(n)

programme.title: JURASSIC PARK
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's masterpiece follows a team of scientists on an island to witness real dinosaurs in a park, only to see everything go wrong when a storm hits.(n)

programme.title: TOWER HEIST
programme.desc: After workers at a luxury condominium discover that a billionaire stole their retirement money, they plot a heist to reclaim what he took from them... and more.(n)

programme.title: DESPICABLE ME 3
programme.desc: Fired from the Anti-Villain League, Gru finds himself in a major identity crisis until the appearance of a mysterious stranger reminds him how good it feels to be bad.(n)

programme.title: HOW TO TRAIN YOUR DRAGON
programme.desc: Set in the mythical world of burly Vikings and wild dragons, a Viking teenager's world is turned upside down when he is challenged by an unusual dragon.(n)

programme.title: THE HUNTSMAN: WINTER'S WAR
programme.desc: The story before Snow White: During the war between two queens, the huntsman must vanquish the evil queen before her wickedness rules for eternity.(n)

programme.title: THE GOLDEN COMPASS

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner (S3)
programme.desc: What could lie beyond the confines of the Milky Way? Are there galaxies similar to our own? Could they be capable of sustaining intelligent life? And is that life trying to contact us?

programme.title: Mysteries Unearthed With Danny Trejo (S1)
programme.desc: From ancient religious texts buried in Egypt to cultural relics found at sea, or even a tower of skulls hiding under the earth—these lost artefacts change what we thought we knew about certain beliefs.

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd (S2)
programme.desc: This episode explores the strangest and most ghastly gigs ever. From night soil men cleaning excrement off the streets of Victorian London to professional mourners hired to weep at funerals!

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd (S2)
programme.desc: From the gruesome sport of toe wrestling to a tight competition between the world's ugliest pets, or the origins of some of our favourite schoolyard face-offs, we're exploring the world of strange games.

programme.title: The Mega-Brands That Built The World (S2)
programme.desc: In the middle of the 20th century, a small piece of plastic revolutionises the world of commerce as Diners' Club, Bank of America, and American Express race to change how people pay for everything.

programme.title: History's Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman (S2)
programme.desc: Rene Belbenoit, a petty thief, is captured and sent to France's notorious penal colony in French Guiana. He determines to escape or die trying. His story becomes the basis of several popular movies.

programme.title: Outside In: Lost in Academia
programme.desc: Korean sociologist Ahn Eunbyul examines Japan's railway culture. Beyond mere transportation, she explores how train travel itself becomes an experience of discovery, nostalgia, and connection.(n)

programme.title: Direct Talk #244
programme.desc: In 2025, Otani Akira's book "The Night of Baba Yaga" won the UKs prestigious Dagger prize for crime fiction in translation-a first for a Japanese author. She shares the inspiration behind her work.(n)

programme.title: The Seasons of Yamato
programme.desc: A series of poetic videos by Koichi Hozan, a videographer living in Nara, in collaboration with a pianist, Mine Kawakami, for which she plays exclusive pieces, makes you experience each seasons.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords - Famous Masterpieces
programme.desc: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, two towering reputations are brought together in one truly special blade: Kaishu Kotetsu.(n)

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: We travel to a well-known tourist resort just outside of Edo, where day-trippers are enjoying river recreation and forest walks, praying at local shrines, and sitting down for riverside picnics.(n)

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: Kiriake Chieko helped cremate schoolmates after the atomic bombing in Hiroshima. At 95, as the oldest surviving witness, she continues to give her testimony, urging people to hold on dearly to peace.(n)

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Winter
programme.desc: At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.(n)
